name: The Sukhothai Bangkok

reviews.title: My wife and I stayed at the Sukhothai...
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Sukhothai right after New years's. It is a first rate hotel so I won't go into every detail but not all rooms are good or equal. You must pay particular attention to where your room is located. Unfortunately, the room we had was on the wrong side of the building, right next to another apt/office building. To go our room we had to go through an exposed walkway where our door was exposed to enviromentL noise (air conditioning units, uncarpeted walkways, heat from the outside, ambient road noise, etc...). For the money paid it was a god awful room that is unbefitting of a 5 star property like the Sukhothai. Therefore, you need to know exactly which room you will get before booking otherwise you could get a real bad one. Definitly not worth the money. We were unable to switch rooms and checked out the next day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That said, I have been to he Sukhothai on previous occassions visiting relatives who have stayed there. I could not speak to the construction noise issue, but the most splendid rooms I have been in were the Sukhothai's rooms above the pool area. They are fantastic and have a nice layout and an overall warm feel.
reviews.title: Noise, noise and noise ! a building under construction just behind!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Regarding food, the Celadon Restaurant is excellent.
reviews.title: Oasis o style and calm in hectic Bangkok

reviews.text: I like really a lot This palace. But, this time it was really disappinting : just behind the hotle they re builiding the new Sukhothai residence. The result is : noisy all the day long : impossible to stay quiet at the pool area, or eveywhere else.
reviews.title: the best city hotel for leisure. anywhere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Forget this hotel for the months to come, go to oriental or Peninsula. to noisy, and no appologize or some reducted bills...no.
reviews.title: Resort feel in the city.

reviews.text: Excellent welcome & reception, very comfortable beds (there is even a pilow menu), fantastic breakfast and Thai cuisine.
reviews.title: Excellent Bangkok hotel

reviews.text: I did find one nasty looking creature in my shower (cockroach ?) but apart from that, the hotel is very clean and the service impeccable.
reviews.title: Excellent Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sukhothai is like an oasis in the middle of the city. As you pass through the grand entrance, you are greeted by staff members who are calling you by name. You really feel like your comfort is their only concern. The rooms are gorgeous with lots of amenities including a "pillow menu", bath salts, chocolates and fruit changed daily...and the list goes on. I can't say enough wonderful things about this beautiful hotel! Make sure you plan the "chocolate buffet" and a trip to the reasonably priced spa...excellent! I went to 5 countries in S.East Asia over this vacation, and this was by far the best hotel experience.
reviews.title: Good 5* in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Sukhothai on the first day of our honeymoon. We arrived after an 11 hour flight from London and were both fried. The staff were great from the beginning, ensuring our check in was fast and painless. We were asked if we would like to upgrade to a suite for 1000bht, which we agreed to.
reviews.title: Excellent! Excellent! Excellent!

reviews.text: After the check in clerk showed us to the suite we realised we had made the right choice. A vast suite with a huge separate bathroom with deep bath and large walk in shower. There were also two separate toilets which was nice.
reviews.title: Great expierence

reviews.text: The srevice was outstanding from the moment you entered to the moment you left. Fresh fruit in your room everyday and the luxury of your own iced water spray by the pool, heaven. In the hustle and bustle of Bangkok this is your oasis of calm and tranquility.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: Sukhothai is a very classic and beautiful hotel of old school charm. I really think it is the top hotel in Bangkok. The staff is so great that I literally want to hug everyone of them:) The only down side is that they allow those poorly dressed guests in their sandals and singlets sitting in this beautiful breakfast room, what a shame.
reviews.title: I had a great stay at the Sukhothai

reviews.text: Excellent quality of service creating a very cosy atmosphere where one feels very wellcome. This is not a tour group hotel, it's a top quality 5 star hotel, with the best swimming pool in town and kindest personal.
reviews.title: Sukhothai remains at the top of its game!

reviews.text: Quiet,restful, nice gardens and ponds. Location is far from shopping. Great breakfast spread. Celadon restaursnt good for fine thai dining. Only problem was the lack of hot/warm water in the shower at 11pm
reviews.title: 1day in bangkok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the best hotels my wife and I stayed at in all our travels! I took my wife to Bangkok as a surprise 30th wedding anniversary gift. Based on reviews at Tripadvisor I booked a room at The Sukhothai. We were not disappointed. The hotel staff, and I mean every one of them, was most gracious and ensured that we had a very pleasant stay. The hotel management surprised us by having a bottle of champagne (in honor of our anniversary) in our room waiting for us when we checked in. That was a nice touch! The hotel consists of a series of buildings (none more than 6-7 floors that I recall) surrounded by lush gardens and ponds. Very different from the skyscraper monstrosities that one often encounters. The hotel grounds were gorgeous. We enjoyed several quiet and serene walks there. The beds were amongst the most comfortable that we had experienced. The buffet breakfast was fabulous!!! Their concierge staff was wonderful. They arranged for a private tour to several places we wanted to visit. The tour guide and driver were excellent and reasonably priced. The one drawback was the hotel was a good 10-15 minute walk to the Skytrain--Bangkok's metro train system...this is a small price to pay for all the benefits of staying at the hotel.
reviews.title: An oasis in the center of the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stay in 1 night and cerebration of my wedding ceremony in this hotel . Everything is perfect and very impressive , organizer and staff hotel is professional and warm greeting
reviews.title: Paradise peaceful and very beautiful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love everything in this hotel . If you like to take a photograph this hotel have a many wonderful location for keep in your valuable memory time
reviews.title: Not Worth The Money

reviews.text: Sunday brunch is perfect many tasteful international food , good quality
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel; a few services glitches

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And you dont miss siradol restaurant is the modern romantic thai food
reviews.title: Impressive Sukhothai

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We treated ourselves to one night at this hotel at the end of our trip before we left Thailand on the recommendation of a friend mainly because we were going to be in need of the spa before we left for our flights home.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel but a Little Impersonal

reviews.text: Had lunch by the pool at the Sukhothai Hotel on Saturday and I can't begin to say what a disaster it was. If I wasn't there as someones guest I would have just walked away.
reviews.title: Inedible food that is massively overpriced and the worst service I have ever had in Thailand

reviews.text: The waiters spent the time standing inside ignoring people outside and our table looked straight on to one of the messiest service areas I have seen in a hotel.
reviews.title: a peacefull and refreshing hotel with beautiful gardens

reviews.text: My bowl of soup noodle arrived luke warm and had been sitting for so long that the noodles had soaked up all the soup and just become mush and thus no soup. And the price was skyhigh. Of the 4 people at out table 3 dishes were left uneaten and no question was asked by the wait staff.
reviews.title: Raw chicken at the Sunday brunch - beware

reviews.text: When the wait staff were asked what was the selection of ice cream and sorbets on the menu the answer, after along pause was, Vanilla.!!! and that's it.
reviews.title: Bangkok Oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't know what was such a good place to have lunch by the pool has allowed to become so bad. Obviously the head waiter and restaurant manager doesn't care.
reviews.title: Retreat in the busy city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a long weekend and found the Hotel to be wonderful. Very peaceful setting you can easily forget (if you want to) that you are only metres away from bustling Bangkok.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.text: The service was absolutely flawless, the best I have experienced. The rooms are very nice, gorgeous pool. Great restaurant.
reviews.title: Sukhothai - Best choice in Bangkok
Amazing, better than the Banyan Tree
reviews.text: I will most definitely stay here again next time I am in BKK.
If you are looking for a relaxing environment in bussy Bangkok, this hotel will please you.
reviews.title: Gorgeous old-fashioned Thai style

reviews.text: Beautifull place (not only the rooms), very friendly and helpfull staff.
reviews.title: Pure luxury in Bangkok

reviews.text: We stayed at this excellent hotel for a couple of days. Nice rooms, wide bathroom and shower, impressive plasma tv screen, very good swimming pool and a modern gym with all facilities. Food is fine, although pricy. However, I think that the regular rooms (not the suites) are a little too far from main lobby and is somewhat complicated to get out. Additionally, I think they should switch the air conditioned on in the corridors heading to the rooms, is too hot there!
reviews.title: excellent hotel, some cons

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Best thing about this hotel is the breakfast and the spa. The rooms are big and spacious but they have low cielings and although it is quality, it is starting to lose its place at the top. Room service was terrble. THe food was inedible, and that was embarrassing. I won't come back here as Bangkok has too many good competitors. Real shame as I remembered this to me a great top 5 star hotel one year ago. Service is very good, but the room service experience will stay with me as a real let down.
reviews.title: Not as good as I remembered it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 4 nights of our holiday here after a week in Koh Samui. We booked the hotel car to pick us up at the airport total luxury! Really wasnt expecting a chauffeur, complete in unifom and cap in a very roomy Merc for under £40!
reviews.title: Outstanding staff

reviews.text: On arrival at the hotel, we were promptly checked in and shown up to our room by the cheeck in staff who spent ages making sure we were ok and that we knew how everything in the room worked. The bed was possibly the most comfortable I have ever slept in and was enormous! Impressive TV and Bose sound system which you can plug your own ipod/iphone/ipad in to. The Japanese style toilet kept me amused for ages (I hadnt come accross one before). It has a heated seat and as well as being a toilet is also an automatic bidet with a control button for what bit you want washed or dried. I giggled and giggled the first time I used it!
reviews.title: Quite simply, the best hotel service that I have ever experienced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite being quite a big hotel (probably predominantly business too), the staff greeted us by name every time we went into the restaurant for breakfast or past the concierge.
reviews.title: one word Service

reviews.text: Recently spent 4 nights at this hotel. I was overall very impressed with the service, room quality and ambiance. Upon arrival, the staff performed a quick check in a we were exhausted after 20 hours of flying. The room was on the small side but had a nice view of the grounds. The hardwood floors were gorgeous and the the bathroom was superb. We had breakfast at the restaurant each morning and found the selection to be good, though not superb. The Celadon restaurant was excellent and had an outstanding set menu for a Thai dinner. The spa was excellent though signficantly overpriced as compared to the massage parlor around the corner. What gives this hotel 5 stars is the service from the staff- outstanding on every level. Particularly the concierge- well done and would definetly return.
reviews.title: Excellent stay...

reviews.text: I thourghly recommend the Sukhothai, very attentive staff. Excellant rooms, breakfast was superb with so much choice of food. The whole atmosphere was superb. The children loved the attention by the staff.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.text: There are so many wonderful things to list about this hotel - tranquil pool, wonderful restaurants, beautiful rooms, and lovely overall aesthetic. But the most outstanding feature is the service. Complimentary truffles and fresh fruit each day, staff remembering our names, the assistance in the business center, and the general quickness that each request was taken care of with and always with a smile. Every morning at breakfast the staff remembered that my fiancée likes the local preparation of iced coffee and even brought out a special iced tea they thought he'd like to try for fun.
reviews.title: Best customer service ever experienced.

reviews.text: But what really impressed us was Wim at concierge. We were flying to Koh Samui the next day and needed to book a ferry transfer from Koh Samui to Koh Tao to get to our non-refundable hotel booking. We didn't realize our timing correlated with the full moon parties and every ferry was booked. Wim worked with Mr. Chatchawan from our hotel on Ko Tao (Charm Churee Villa) and the two somehow managed to secure us tickets, even confirming the car transfers as well.
reviews.title: My home when in Bangkok

reviews.text: Our day of travel was seamless thanks to Wim and Mr. Chatchawan (will provide a review for Charm Churee as well, after our stay).
reviews.title: Candid opinion

reviews.text: We booked 2 rooms and when we arrived at 12:00 our rooms (Deluxe Studio) were not ready yet. Because they wanted our rooms to be next to each other, they gave us a double upgrade to a Deluxe Suite! What a room that was, fantastic!! They also gave us a complementary high tea, because we booked a 3 night stay!! At one day we wanted to go for a trip outside Bangkok with a train and they called the trainstation for us and they printed some information about our destination. The service is fantastic!! The breakfast is also great. The only negatives are the food and beverage prices!! EUR 6,- for softdrinks and cappuccino!!! 10 years ago you good get cheap food and drinks in Bangkok also in 5 star hotels, but now the prices are really high!! The food is also very expensive, but good. There are also very much business men at this hotel. But we were very happy with this hotel and they made us really happy!! Thank you.
reviews.title: Good service hotel
Amazing all round- my favourite
reviews.text: Never before have I felt compelled to write a review on trip advisor- however the Sukhothai was that great that I felt I must share how fantastic our experience was. The staff and very pleasant and helpful and the room was beautiful (with lovely soft comfy bed) and I couldnt not mention the electric toilet - big thumbs up!!!
Wow! What a place. Really is an oasis of tranquility with amazing spaces and rooms that just make you feel relaxed and special. Thailand really is the THE place for providing great, genuine service.
reviews.title: Exceptional experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great, right in the heart of Silom Rd.
reviews.title: Flawless

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They think of everything to make your stay an experience: Mood lighting in the bathroom, your own coffee machine in the room (with capsules, no Nescafe sachets) which is great if you are a coffee addict like me. You are personally taken to your room and shown how to work all the gadgets. You have an ipod docking station that fits into a bose sound system, every type of phone charger you could think of, a proper workstation at your desk, control panel for lighting/aircon at your bedside table.
reviews.title: Oasis of quietness in a busy city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at The Sukhothai Bangkok recently as a prelude to our trip to Bhutan and Myanmar. The reason we picked this hotel was so that we can relax after the long flight from Chicago. And did we ever relax. We had a very quiet room. The decor was inviting.The staff was very helpful, the breakfast was everything you wanted, both Asian and Western foods, the location was close to attractions, and the spa had massages that did wonders to work out the kinks from our flight. We would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: A Welcome Retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I came here with my girlfriend as a first trip to Bangkok. The hotel was fabulous and it was a lovely respite from the somewhat polluted Bangkok. Don't get me wrong, I've been a few places in the world and the hotel can sometime make or break a holiday and this one definitely made it. I've read the other reviews I agree totally with everything they've said...secluded, lovely bathroom, pool, excellent service etc. After one day of exploring Bangkok and getting ripped off by taxi/tuk tuk drivers and shop keepers alike (I know, its Bangkok!!) we sat in the bar and had a couple of Singha beers - Lovely bar too but after the day, the beer prices were almost 5 times what I would get outside the hotel!!
reviews.title: 1st Bangkok experience - Great hotel

reviews.text: I know I'm really to paying for the lovely decor and fully attentive staff but it was just another way of squeezing the stupid tourist. I know things are all relative and in comparison to London and its cheap but....we're not in London. Also the room service prices I thought was were quite steep especially the local dishes...western food I understood but Pad Thai....surely that's a more 'staple' order. Don't get me wrong, I'm griping on a few issues but I thought it worth saying.
reviews.title: Oasis tucked away in the concrete jungle

reviews.text: On the other hand the breakfast was AMAZING and you could have had every breakfast alternative under the sun. The pool was great and the staff was fantastic. Do stay here - without doubt - there are some nice restaurants nearby and you are right next to the Banyan Tree roof bar (a must if it’s your first time). There is also the ping pong bars of Patpong Road literally 15 mins walk away but when you're at the hotel it feels a million miles away - the immediate area is definitely not seedy (so don’t worry) as you're surrounded by a number of the major embassies. Good walking distance to the sky train (approx. 10 mins walk) and you can get to the river from there if you wish (which we did). This place is an oasis of calm for anyone with a solid standard of excellence.
reviews.title: the service quality impressed me...

reviews.text: I just returned from a 2-night stay in the Sukhothai. The hotel is inconspicously tucked away from the main road and is surprisingly quiet despite fairly near the busy road. Hotel staff are extremely courteous and always helpful and make you feel important to them. A one-to-one hotel staff will escort you to the room and explain to you the amenities and facilities offered to its guests. A stayed on the 4th floor in a standard room which faces the court yard with its pool. The room is clean, comfortable with a big double bed enough for 3 adults to sleep comfortably. Pillows are aplenty with a choice of the type you wish for from a pillow menu. A working table with an array of electrical adaptors for different devices is available. Internet in the room is free and of decent speed even when watching HD on You Tube. The bathroom is well designed and there is a deep, long bath to soak your tired body and legs after your shopping. My room has a coffee making machine with a fair selection of quality coffee powder in air-tight capsule. I did not use the gymn or swimming pool. The subway MRT (Lumphini station) is just about 8 min walk from the hotel. From here you can take the subway to Sukhumvit station (3 stations away) for 20 BHT. From Sukhumvit station you can take the BTS to almost anywhere within the city. Breakfast is standard with Japanese and a bit of local fares (Dim sum, noodles) and European pastries. You are welcomed by your name if you happen to stay for more than 1 night! I was impressed by this as I believe no other hotel does that. I want to single out Ms Yim whom I think is the restaurant captain on the 6th and 7th Aug mornings when I had breakfast at the Colonnade. Overall the hotel has a life of its own uniqueness though some reviewers may not agree to it. Definitely worth every BHT of your stay at the Sukhothai.
reviews.title: Once in Thailand, always at The Sukhothai Bangkok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good hotel which on the basis of the room rate alone is about what we would expect. Very elegant, good room, well decorated. Breakfast was good (but expensive if it isn't in your package). Again, one of my biggest complaints about some of these hotels is why do we have to pay so much for internet access which is free in much less well appointed hotels. Also the bar prices were more expensive than in London when you worked it out. We have already paid good money for the hotel and I just don't appreciate being "gouged" further.
reviews.title: Luxury with Expensive Add-ons

reviews.text: Pool a little small and loses the sun in the afternoon, particuarly behind a new building that is going up behind the hotel.
reviews.title: Outstanding in every way. Superb architecture, excellent staff, great food.

reviews.text: Staff were polite and well mannered. All in all very enjoyable apart from the charge for "extras".
reviews.title: The Garden of Eden in noisy Bangkok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bangkok abounds in top-class 5-star hotels, many famous in their own right, and most of the major luxury hotel chains are represented: Mandarin Oriental, Peninsular, InterContinental, Sofitel, Shangri-La, Four Seasons, Dusit, Banyan Tree and so on. Over the years I've stayed in a number, usually the Shangri-La or the InterContinental, all of which have been very good. This time, however, I followed a friend's advice and stayed at The Sukhothai, and I'm very happy I did. In every respect, my four days at The Sukhothai were wonderful.
reviews.title: amazing - you must stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all there is the archtecture. Almost without exception, the luxury hotels in Bangkok could be anywhere in the world: sleek, modern, glass-and-concrete-and-steel towers surrounded by the teeming street life and traffic that is modern Bangkok. The Sukhothai, on the other hand, is quintessentially Thai, having been designed by Paris-based American architect Ed Tuttle, who is also responsible for some of Aman's most beautiful hotels. Tuttle's design has created an oasis of calm and serenity, with fountains, reflecting pools, shady arcades, greenery, Thai sculpture and architectural details. In fact, it is the attention to detail, especially in the spacious and comfortable guest rooms, that really set The Sukhothai apart from other 5-star hotels I've stayed at in Bangkok: there are just so many exquisite design touches, uniquely Tuttle, that personalise the hotel, and make it intimate rather than monumental. It is an interesting contrast to the adjacent Banyan Tree, which, despite the name, is a mammoth concrete tower projecting dozens of floors above the city; The Sukhothai is a mere four floors high. Many rooms were recently renovated under the very watchful eye of Mr Tuttle himself. And I have to mention the beautiful bathrooms.
reviews.title: Hands down, best higher end place to stay in Bangkok

reviews.text: Until now I have stayed at the Oriental when in Bangkok. With the exception of not being on the river, the Sukhothai scores higher in every category, and I will not be going back.
reviews.title: Superb in every way
Lovely Hotel - Boutiquey but with all 5* amenities
reviews.text: The Sukhothai is beautiful, elegant and restful. Though a large hotel and fairly full, we sometimes had the impression the place was almost empty. The rooms are elegant, spacious and understated.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room service, pool service, gym and health club service, reception were all superb. Individual likes/dislikes were noted immediately and remembered consistently.
reviews.title: Pure luxury

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet, though a bit pricey, was excellent.
reviews.title: Fantastic, as always

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is attitude free (there are no stuffy rules about what you can wear): it's all about you and your comfort and pleasure.
reviews.title: Better than any other hotel in Bangkok!
